TWD.DefMacroHint: Enable a shortened macro syntax which allows referencing attributes directly, for example @str instead of @attributes.str.value. Disable this setting if you need the ability to reference the full attribute model, for example @attributes.str.label.
TWD.DefProtoHint: Automatically set advised prototype token settings to newly created Actors.

TWD.EditItem: Left Click to Edit, Right click to open context menu.
TWD.forceImportHint: Forces a reimport to occur as if this is the module's initial launch.  This will not overwrite existing data but will replace missing data.
TWD.hideChatBGImageNote: Check this to hide the facehugger background image in chat.
TWD.hideInitChatHint: Check this to hide chat messages for Initiative rolls
TWD.hideJournalBGImageNote: Hide the Background Image on Journal Entries

TWD.NoToken: You do not have a token selected
TWD.NPCpopUp: Checking this box will cause all tokens created to be Unlinked and Hostile.
TWD.Panic1: KEEPING IT TOGETHER: You manage to keep your nerves in check. Barely.
TWD.Panic10: FREEZE:  You’re frozen by fear or stress for one Round, losing your next slow action. Your STRESS LEVEL, and the STRESS LEVEL of all friendly PCs in SHORT range of you, increases by one
TWD.Panic11: SEEK COVER:  You must use your next action to move away from danger and find a safe spot if possible. You are allowed to make a retreat roll (see page 93) if you have an enemy at ENGAGED range. Your STRESS LEVEL is decreased by one, but the STRESS LEVEL of all friendly PCs in SHORT range increases by one. After one Round, you can act normally.
TWD.Panic12: SCREAM: You scream your lungs out for one Round, losing your next slow action. Your STRESS LEVEL is decreased by one, but every friendly character who hears your scream must make an immediate Panic Roll.
TWD.Panic13: FLEE:  You just can’t take it anymore. You must flee to a safe place and refuse to leave it. You won’t attack anyone and won’t attempt anything dangerous. You are not allowed to make a retreat roll (see page 93) if you have an enemy at ENGAGED range when you flee. Your STRESS LEVEL is decreased by one, but every friendly character who sees you run must make an immediate Panic Roll.
TWD.Panic14: BERSERK:  You must immediately attack the nearest person or creature, friendly or not. You won’t stop until you or the target is Broken. Every friendly character who witnesses your rampage must make an immediate Panic Roll
TWD.Panic15: CATATONIC:  You collapse to the floor and can’t talk or move, staring blankly into oblivion.
TWD.Panic7: NERVOUS TWITCH:  Your STRESS LEVEL, and the STRESS LEVEL of all friendly PCs in SHORT range of you, increases by one.
TWD.Panic8: TREMBLE:  You start to tremble uncontrollably. All skill rolls using AGILITY suffer a –2 modification until your panic stops.
TWD.Panic9: DROP ITEM:  Whether by stress, confusion or the realization that you’re all going to die anyway, you drop a weapon or other important item—the GM decides which one. Your STRESS LEVEL increases by one.
TWD.PCPanicLevel: PC's Panic level has increased by one step to
TWD.PermanantTrauma: Permanent Trauma. Make an EMPATHY roll at the end of the session.
TWD.ResetNote: NOTE: Save, Reset and CRT UI will cause FVTT to reload.
TWD.RollPanic: Roll either Wits or Empathy (right click) with the appropriate modifiers
TWD.Seepage104: See page 104 of the Alien rule book.
TWD.Seepage106: See page 105 of the Alien rule book.

TWD.SwitchKeysHint: Switch to Right Mouse for Rolls and left Mouse for Mods
TWD.SynthDontNeed: Synthetics don’t need air, food, water, or sleep. They are immune to vacuum, cold, and disease. Androids are typically unaffected by alien pathogens.
